attributes.action: Section 60 in London to be in place all the time
attributes.background: Give more power to the police forces for stop and search in London until the huge  number of stabbings will go down .

rejection.details:
Section 60 of the Criminal Justice and Public Order Act 1994 is still in effect. It is therefore not clear what you want the Government to do. Decisions about when to use stop and search powers, including those provided under Section 60 of this Act, are a matter for individual police forces, not the Government or House of Commons.

You could start a petition calling for a specific change to be made to the Criminal Justice and Public Order Act, but it would need to be clear what change you want to be made.
